alert.note: Alert for Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Southern Westchester in New York. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM EDT, emergency management reported lingering flooding from earlier rainfall when between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain fell. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yonkers, New Rochelle, Port Chester, Rye, Greenwich, Scarsdale, Bronxville, Mount Vernon, Eastchester, Mamaroneck, Hastings-on-Hudson, Greenville, Pelham, Tuckahoe, Larchmont, Pelham Manor and Ardsley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
